change_history.change: Removed a topic (Adding photos) + index changes
Added the last help topic (Voice tags) to the file.

topic.synonyms: adding creating contacts cards information writing creating name number phonebook entry thumbnail image photo
topic.paragraph: To create a new contact card, go to Menu > Contacts: Options > New contact. Fill in the contact information in the fields of the card.
topic.tip: To add a thumbnail image to the contact card, press Options and select Add thumbnail. Scroll to the memory from which you want to retrieve the image and press the joystick. Scroll to the desired image and press the joystick. The thumbnail image is shown when the contact calls you.
To add, rename, or delete contact card fields, press Options and selectAdd detail, Edit label, or Delete detail.
topic.paragraph: To save the contact card and return to the Contacts directory, press Done.

topic.synonyms: editing changing modifying contacts information cards phonebook entries names numbers
topic.paragraph: To add or edit contact information in a contact card, go to Menu > Contacts, scroll to the card, and press Options > Edit.
topic.tip: To add a thumbnail image to the contact card, press Options and select Add thumbnail. Scroll to the memory from which you want to retrieve the image and press the joystick. Scroll to the desired image and press the joystick. The thumbnail image is shown when the contact calls you.
To add, rename, or delete contact card fields, press Options and select Add detail, Edit label, or Delete detail.
topic.paragraph: To save the contact card and return to the Contacts directory, press Done.

topic.synonyms: contacts directory names list phonebook numbers
topic.paragraph: To view and manage contact information such as phone numbers and addresses, go to Menu > Contacts.
To view a contact card, scroll to the contact and press the joystick.
To call a contact, scroll to the contact and press the Call key.
You can also scroll to a contact, press Options, and select:

list.listitem: Edit to modify the contact information.
Duplicate to create a copy of the contact card.
Add to group to add the contact to a contact group.
Belongs to groups to see the contact groups to which the contact belongs.
Copy to SIM direct. to copy the contact name and phone number to your SIM card.
Go to web address to browse the page that you have saved to the contact.
Send business card to send the contact card to other devices.
Contacts info > Memory to view information about the memory consumption of Contacts.
Contacts info > Voice tags to view a list of voice tags.
SIM directory to view, add, edit, or delete contact names and phone numbers stored on your SIM card.
Service numbers to access phone numbers for different network services such as telephone directories or technical troubleshooting.
Settings to change the order in which all first and last contact names are displayed.

topic.paragraph: To remove a contact from the directory, scroll to the contact and press <C>.
topic.tip: To view contact groups or create new groups, move the joystick to the right.

topic.synonyms: contact groups cards list managing creating viewing opening members
topic.paragraph: To view and manage contact groups or to create new groups, go to Menu > Contacts and move the joystick to the right.
topic.tip: With contact groups you can, for example, send messages to a number of people at the same time.
topic.paragraph: To view or edit contact groups, scroll to the group and press the joystick.
To create a new contact group, press Options and select New group.
topic.tip: To add members to a contact group, scroll to the group and press the joystick. Press Options and select Add members.
topic.paragraph: You can also scroll to a group, press Options and select:

list.listitem: Ringing tone to set a special ringing tone to alert you whenever a member of the group calls.
Contacts info > Memory to view information about the memory consumption of Contacts.
Contacts info > Voice tags to view a list of voice tags.
Settings to change the order in which all first and last contact names are displayed.

topic.paragraph: To delete a contact group, scroll to the group and press <C>. Note that the individual contact cards of the group members remain in the Contacts directory.
topic.tip: To return to the Contacts directory, move the joystick to the left.

topic.synonyms: contact group cards viewing editing members sending
topic.paragraph: To view or manage contact groups, go to Menu > Contacts and move the joystick to the right. Scroll to a contact group and press the joystick.
To view the contact information of a group member, scroll to the member and press the joystick.
To call a group member, scroll to the member and press the Call key.
You can also scroll to a group member, press Options, and select:

list.listitem: Remove from group to remove the contact from the group. The contact remains in your Contacts directory.
Belongs to groups to check to which other groups the member belongs.
Add members to add members to the group. Scroll to the desired contact and press the joystick.
Send business card to send the contact card of the member to other devices.

topic.synonyms: phonebook names groups order first last entries viewing
topic.paragraph: To change the order of the first names and last names in a contact card, go to Menu > Contacts: Options > Settings.
In Name display, press the joystick to select Last name, First or First Last name.

topic.synonyms: managing contact cards phonebook entries viewing modifying
topic.paragraph: To view specific contact information, go to Menu > Contacts, scroll to a contact, and press the joystick.
To manage or edit the contact information, press Options and select:

list.listitem: Go to web address to browse the page that you have saved to the contact.
Edit to modify the contact information.
Defaults to have the phone automatically select the phone numbers and e-mail address when you call or send messages to the contact.
Add voice tag to record a voice tag and then call the contact simply by saying the tag aloud.

topic.note: The available options depend on the contact card field that you have scrolled to.

list.listitem: Assign speed dial to add a speed dial to a phone number of the contact and then call the contact by pressing only one number key.
Ringing tone to add a personal ringing tone that is played when the contact calls.
Copy to SIM direct. to copy the contact name and phone number to your SIM card.
Send business card to send the contact card to other devices.

topic.synonyms: adding changing removing deleting recording voice tags managing contacts phonebook entries numbers phone
topic.paragraph: To listen to, change, or remove voice tags that you have recorded for your contacts, open Contacts: Options > Contacts info > Voice tags.
topic.tip: To add a voice tag to a phone number, open Contacts, scroll to the contact whose number you want to add a voice tag to, and press the joystick. Scroll to the number, press Options and select Add voice tag.
topic.paragraph: To listen to a voice tag, scroll to the contact and press the joystick.
To replace a voice tag, scroll to the contact, press Options, and select Change.
To delete a voice tag, scroll to the contact and press <C>.
topic.tip: To use voice commands to call a contact, in standby mode, press and hold the right selection key. Once you hear a tone, say the voice tag exactly as you recorded it.
